metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21834 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description: An exploitable integer overflow vulnerability exists within the MPEG-4 decoding functionality of the GPAC Project on Advanced Content library v1.0.1. A specially crafted MPEG-4 input when decoding the atom for the “co64” FOURCC can cause an integer overflow due to unchecked arithmetic resulting in a heap-based buffer overflow that causes memory corruption. An attacker can convince a user to open a video to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: gpac package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
